item.title: Gluon fusion to diphoton plus jets with amplitude neural networks
item.description: Our new paper Optimising simulations for diphoton production at hadron colliders using amplitude neural networks was listed on the arXiv today. I posted about the code for this project yesterday.

item.title: n3jet_diphoton version 1 release
item.description: Our project n3jet_diphoton demonstrates the use of neural networks for high precision scattering amplitudes within Monte Carlo event generator simulations for hadronic colliders. We finalised the code today along with a preprint submission that will be listed on the arXiv tomorrow.

item.title: Gluon fusion to diphoton plus jet at two loops
item.description: Today the preprint of our article Virtual QCD corrections to gluon-initiated diphoton plus jet production at hadron colliders appeared on the arXiv.

item.title: NJet version 3 release
item.description: Today I released a new version of NJet. It includes all the feature contributions I have made to the NJet library over the last two years, including a couple of two-loop analytic amplitudes as well as some one-loop diphoton processes and a library of infrared limit functions.

item.title: YTF20 presentation: introduction to precision QCD
item.description: I was on the committee for the YTF 2019 and YTF 2020 conferences. For YTF20, I also gave a non-specialist talk on precision QCD. The talk is recorded and the slides are available here (source) (discussion of tech).

item.title: CV update
item.description: When applying to the SAGEX School in Mathematica and Maple, I had to provide a CV, which was good motivation to update my CV (source) and current research statement (source).

item.title: Outreach with a Galton board
item.description: At the IPPP, I’m involved with the outreach programme. Aside from helping to run events, I also did a bit of maintenance on the Galton board exhibit, which I wrote about on our Computing Club website. In recent quarantined times, I experimented with a virtual version (source), which I discussed here.

item.title: BUSSTEPP presentation: precision QCD with diphotons
item.description: I attended British Universities Summer School in Theoretical Elementary Particle Physics 2019. We all gave a short presentation of our research. Here are my slides (alt) (source).
